required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Metabolic Effects of Olanzapine in Healthy Males
clinical_study.official_title: Metabolic Effects of Olanzapine in Healthy Males

lead_sponsor.agency: State University of New York at Buffalo

clinical_study.source: State University of New York at Buffalo

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to look at how a two-week use of a medication called Olanzapine might change appetite, physical activity, resting metabolic rate, body composition, and weight in healthy men.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Body Composition
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline and 2 weeks of treatment (olanzapine or placebo)
secondary_outcome.description: lean body mass (kg) and fat mass (kg) at baseline and after 2 weeks of treatment with olanzapine or placebo

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in 24-Hour Dietary Recall
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at different time points: baseline and 2 weeks of treatment (olanzapine or placebo)
secondary_outcome.description: 24-hour dietary intake recall at baseline and after 2 weeks of treatment with olanzapine or placebo

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Resting Metabolic Rate
secondary_outcome.description: Resting metabolic rate at baseline and after 2 weeks of treatment

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at different time points: baseline and 2 weeks of treatment (olanzapine or placebo)
secondary_outcome.description: Triglycerides (mg/dl) at baseline and after 2 weeks of treatment with olanzapine or placebo

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at different time points: baseline and 2 weeks of treatment (olanzapine or placebo)
secondary_outcome.description: Glucose (mg/dl) at baseline and after 2 weeks of treatment with olanzapine or placebo

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at different time points: baseline and 2 weeks of treatment (olanzapine or placebo)
secondary_outcome.description: Leptin (ng/ml) at baseline and after 2 weeks of treatment with olanzapine or placebo

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at different time points: baseline and 2 weeks of treatment (olanzapine or placebo)
secondary_outcome.description: Insulin (µIU/ml) at baseline and after 2 weeks of treatment with olanzapine or placebo
Total cholesterol at baseline and after 2 weeks treatment with olanzapine or placebo
Low-density lipoprotein at baseline and after 2 weeks of treatment with olanzapine or placebo
High-density lipoprotein at baseline and after 2 weeks of treatment with olanzapine or placebo

secondary_outcome.measure: Physical Activity as Measured Using a Physical Activity Monitor
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in physical activity. Physical activity was measured using an activity monitor that subjects wore around their waist throughout baseline and treatment days. Subjects were instructed to remove the monitor when sleeping or engaging in water-based activities, and to report on a daily log the times that they were wearing and removing the device. Physical activity was monitored during weekdays and weekend days. Physical activity data were collected in 60-second epochs. The results are reported as average counts per day of physical activity for weekdays and weekend days at baseline and 2 week treatment.

other_outcome.description: Total kcal intake at breakfast in a laboratory setting at baseline and after 2 week of treatment with olanzapine or placebo

intervention.description: Olanzapine 5mg capsule administered orally at bedtime for 7 days followed by Olanzapine 10 mg capsule administered orally at bedtime for 7 days.
Placebo capsule administered orally at bedtime for 14 days

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy Volunteer
- Male
- Aged 18-35 years
- Body Mass Index (BMI): <30 kg/m2
Exclusion Criteria:
- Presence of any medical disorder that may confound the assessment of relevant biological measures

facility.name: Department of Psychiatry, The State University of New York at Buffalo

group.description: Placebo: Placebo capsule administered orally at bedtime for 14 days Six subjects from the placebo group completed the 2-week double-blind trial and were included in the analysis.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Body Composition
outcome.description: lean body mass (kg) and fat mass (kg) at baseline and after 2 weeks of treatment with olanzapine or placebo
outcome.time_frame: baseline and 2 weeks of treatment (olanzapine or placebo)
outcome.population: The Body Composition assessment was not implemented at the start of the study but once the study already started. Therefore, not all study participants who completed the study got the Body Composition assessment done. Only 3 participants in the Placebo Group and 6 participants in the Olanzapine Group got the Body Composition assessment done.

Only 3 participants in the Placebo Group and 6 participants in the Olanzapine Group got the Body Composition assessment done.

outcome.population: Note regarding the difference between the Overall Number of Participants Analyzed and the Participant Flow: Blood sample could not be collected from 1 participant from the Placebo Group and 1 participant from the Olanzapine Group. outcome.title: Physical Activity as Measured Using a Physical Activity Monitor
outcome.description: Change from baseline in physical activity. Physical activity was measured using an activity monitor that subjects wore around their waist throughout baseline and treatment days. Subjects were instructed to remove the monitor when sleeping or engaging in water-based activities, and to report on a daily log the times that they were wearing and removing the device. Physical activity was monitored during weekdays and weekend days. Physical activity data were collected in 60-second epochs. The results are reported as average counts per day of physical activity for weekdays and weekend days at baseline and 2 week treatment.
outcome.population: Due to poor participant's compliance with the study requirements for physical activity data collection, the data from 4 participants from the olanzapine group could not be used for analysis purpose.

group.description: Placebo: Placebo capsule administered orally at bedtime for 14 days

group.description: Olanzapine: Olanzapine 5mg capsule administered orally at bedtime for 7 days followed by Olanzapine 10 mg capsule administered orally at bedtime for 7 days.

measure.title: Physical Activity as Measured Using a Physical Activity Monitor
measure.description: Change from baseline in physical activity. Physical activity was measured using an activity monitor that subjects wore around their waist throughout baseline and treatment days. Subjects were instructed to remove the monitor when sleeping or engaging in water-based activities, and to report on a daily log the times that they were wearing and removing the device. Physical activity was monitored during weekdays and weekend days. Physical activity data were collected in 60-second epochs. The results are reported as average counts per day of physical activity for weekdays and weekend days at baseline and 2 week treatment.
measure.population: Due to poor participant's compliance with the study requirements for physical activity data collection, the data from 4 participants from the olanzapine group could not be used for analysis purpose.

outcome.title: Laboratory Breakfast Intake
outcome.description: Total kcal intake at breakfast in a laboratory setting at baseline and after 2 week of treatment with olanzapine or placebo
outcome.population: The Laboratory Breakfast Intake assessment was not performed at the start of the study but was initiated during the course of the study. Only 3 participants from the Placebo group and 6 participants from the Olanzapine group completed the Laboratory Breakfast Intake assessment.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: The small sample size, the exclusion of obese subjects, and the short olanzapine exposure in the current study may limit the interpretation and generalizability of our findings.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Dr. Elsa Daurignac, Research Assistant Professor
